title: MPs demand crackdown to stop more online banking failures causing chaos for millions
text:
Banks should face a regulatory crackdown and higher industry levies to tackle an “unacceptable” surge in IT failures that have caused chaos for millions of online banking customers, MPs said on Monday.

The Treasury Select Committee’s call follows high-profile disruption at a string of players including Barclays, Visa Europe and - most notoriously - challenger bank TSB - amid increasing dependence on online banking.

Almost three-quarters of UK adults now use online banking, while the number of bank branches has halved to about 11,000 since the mid-1980s.
